questions.question: 1. What does the quantum number n represent in the Schr√∂dinger equation?

answers.b: The energy level of the particle

questions.question: 2. What is the purpose of the time-dependent part of the wavefunction in the equation?

answers.a: To describe the spatial distribution of the particle
answers.b: To describe the amplitude of the wavefunction
answers.c: To describe how the wavefunction evolves over time
answers.d: To calculate the value of n

questions.question: 3. What happens to the energy levels when the width of a potential well decreases?

answers.c: Energy levels become more widely spaced

explanations.c: In a narrower potential well, confinement increases, causing quantized energy levels to become more widely spaced.

questions.question: 4. Which statement correctly describes the wavefunction inside an infinite potential well?

answers.b: The wavefunction is sinusoidal inside the well and zero at the boundaries
answers.c: The wavefunction is constant throughout the well
answers.d: The wavefunction increases linearly with position

explanations.b: In an infinite potential well, the wavefunction is sinusoidal inside and must be zero at the boundaries because the particle cannot exist outside the well.

questions.question: 5. Why can't a particle in an infinite potential well have zero energy (E = 0)?

answers.a: Because zero energy violates the uncertainty principle
answers.b: Because the particle has too much mass
answers.c: Because the well width is infinite
answers.d: Because the time-dependent wavefunction becomes undefined

explanations.a: A particle confined to a finite region must have some kinetic energy due to the uncertainty principle; E = 0 is not allowed.
